abstract: The source audio channel layouts the audio renderer supports for spatialization.
overview:
## Discussion

The default property value is [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVAudioSpatializationFormats/multichannel], which tells the player to spatialize any decodable multichannel layout. Setting the value to [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVAudioSpatializationFormats/monoStereoAndMultichannel] tells the player to spatialize any decodable mono, stereo, or multichannel layout. When this property value is [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVAudioSpatializationFormats/monoAndStereo] the player attempts to spatialize content tagged with a stereo channel layout (two-channel content with no layout specified as well as mono).

This property isn’t key-value observable.

# allowedAudioSpatializationFormats

**Instance Property**

The source audio channel layouts the audio renderer supports for spatialization.

## Declaration

```swift
var allowedAudioSpatializationFormats: AVAudioSpatializationFormats { get set }
```

## Discussion

The default property value is [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVAudioSpatializationFormats/multichannel], which tells the player to spatialize any decodable multichannel layout. Setting the value to [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVAudioSpatializationFormats/monoStereoAndMultichannel] tells the player to spatialize any decodable mono, stereo, or multichannel layout. When this property value is [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVAudioSpatializationFormats/monoAndStereo] the player attempts to spatialize content tagged with a stereo channel layout (two-channel content with no layout specified as well as mono).

This property isn’t key-value observable.
title: allowedAudioSpatializationFormats
